channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Rebels make gains in southern Syria, push on Damascus
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Mohamad El Chamaa, Kelsey Ables, Vivian Ho
item.description: Syrian rebel groups reported gains in the country’s south on Saturday, advancing in Daraa and putting pressure on the capital Damascus.

item.title: A major cocaine transit country is halting U.S. anti-drug cooperation
item.dc:creator: Kevin Sieff, Samantha Schmidt
item.description: Paraguay’s antidrug agency has decided to halt cooperation with the United States, a significant blow to U.S. efforts to curb organized crime in the country.

item.title: South Korea’s president avoids impeachment after martial law misstep
item.dc:creator: Michelle Lee
item.description: A vote to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol failed after a ruling party boycott meant ballots cast failed to pass the minimum threshold in the National Assembly.

item.title: The reopening of Notre Dame through the eyes of people who saved it
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis
item.description: These are the stories of people oversaw the fire response, rescued relics, stabilized statues, preserved stained glass and built the new spire.

item.title: Asian farmworkers are being killed in Israel’s embattled border regions
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan

item.title: Asian farmworkers are being killed in Israel’s embattled border regions
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Heidi Levine
item.description: Despite repeated protests from their countries, Israel has continued to let migrant laborers work in high-risk military zones.

item.title: Why capture of Syrian city Homs could be key moment in rebel offensive
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: Austin Tice, journalist missing in Syria, is alive, mother says, citing ‘vetted’ source
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall

item.title: Austin Tice, journalist missing in Syria, is alive, mother says, citing ‘vetted’ source
item.dc:creator: Sammy Westfall
item.description: The Tice family spoke in Washington after meeting with U.S. officials, urging the Biden administration to “follow through” on plans to pursue his release.

item.title: As lawmakers move to impeach South Korean President Yoon, what happens next?
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Michelle Lee
item.description: Calls are growing for South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s ouster after he declared then rescinded martial law. Here’s how an impeachment would work.

item.title: Many targeted for removal by Trump can’t be deported, ICE data shows
item.dc:creator: Nick Miroff
item.description: Some would-be deportees’s home countries won’t take them or limit cooperation with ICE. Others have received reprieves or deferrals from immigration judges.

item.title: Romanian court annuls presidential vote after Russian interference claims
item.dc:creator: Madalin Necsutu, Anthony Faiola
item.description: Calin Georgescu won the first round of the election after being propelled by TikTok. Romania’s security services pointed to “Russian hybrid actions.”

item.title: Why capture of Syrian city Homs could be key moment in rebel offensive
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch
item.description: Capturing Homs, Syria’s third-largest city, would be a major victory in a rebel offensive that already has captured Aleppo and Hama.

item.title: After taking two key cities, Syrian rebels set their sights on Homs
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Adela Suliman, Bryan Pietsch, Mohamad El Chamaa, Sammy Westfall
item.description: After Hayat Tahrir al-Sham gained control of Hama, rebels are seeking to take Homs, as they continue their breakneck advance across Syria.

item.title: Why capture of Syrian city Homs could be key moment in rebel offensive
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch

item.title: More doctors and patients forced out of North Gaza hospital, director says
item.dc:creator: Miriam Berger, Hazem Balousha, Hajar Harb

item.title: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, the Islamist rebel leading the Syrian advance?
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor

item.title: Who is Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, the Islamist rebel leading the Syrian advance?
item.dc:creator: Adam Taylor
item.description: The 42-year-old Syrian was once a shadowy figure leading an al-Qaeda offshoot. Now he’s stepping into the spotlight.

item.title: Health officials grapple with deadly mystery ‘Disease X’ in Congo
item.dc:creator: Vivian Ho
item.description: The mysterious flu-like disease has killed dozens in the central African country of the Democratic Republic of Congo, mostly women and children, officials said.

item.title: Rebel advance in Syria threatens to unravel Putin’s previous triumph
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon

item.title: Melbourne synagogue suffers ‘extensive damage’ in suspected arson
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables
item.description: A motive has not yet been determined, but Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese decried the attack as antisemitic.

item.title: Christians in Aleppo fear for their future after Islamist takeover
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Joe Snell

item.title: Melbourne synagogue suffers ‘extensive damage’ in suspected arson
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables

item.title: Notre Dame unveiled
item.dc:creator: Aaron Steckelberg, Annabelle Timsit, Marisa Bellack
item.description: As the cathedral reopens, take our interactive graphics tour of the interior and exterior to see what was saved, what was rebuilt and what’s new.

item.title: Rebel advance in Syria threatens to unravel Putin’s previous triumph
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon
item.description: The successful intervention on behalf of Syrian President Bashar al-Assad almost 10 years ago underscored Putin’s assertion that Russia was still a global power.

item.title: Syrian rebels take Hama, a second major city, in another blow to Assad
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Christians in Aleppo fear for their future after Islamist takeover
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Joe Snell
item.description: Though the rebels, once affiliated with al-Qaeda, have sought to soften their image in recent years, many worry they will revert to their repressive roots.

item.title: New efforts underway to reach Gaza ceasefire deal, officials say; Syrian rebels take new city
item.dc:creator: Mohamad El Chamaa, Niha Masih, Vivian Ho, Kareem Fahim, Bryan Pietsch, Sammy Westfall, Hazem Balousha
item.description: A Syrian Islamist rebel group said Thursday it has entered neighborhoods in the central city of Hama.

item.title: Syrian rebels take Hama, a second major city, in another blow to Assad
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa

item.title: Post Reports: A surprising turn in Syria’s civil war
item.dc:creator: Washington Post staff

item.title: France’s Macron rules out resigning, will tap new prime minister
item.dc:creator: Ellen Francis, Annabelle Timsit
item.description: The French president said he would name a new prime minister in days, as he scolded the far-right and left factions that toppled the government in a no-confidence vote.

item.title: Syrian rebels take Hama, a second major city, in another blow to Assad
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: The Islamist rebels’ breakneck advance has redrawn the country’s front lines and revealed the fragility of the government’s security forces.

item.title: Two arrested in Romania in stabbing of Iranian journalist in London
item.dc:creator: Greg Miller
item.description: The men are suspected of carrying out a stabbing attack on an Iranian journalist in London on behalf of Tehran.

item.title: Renewed calls for ceasefire after IDF recovers hostage’s body
item.dc:creator: Claire Parker, Lior Soroka

item.title: A viral song becomes the latest symbol of Venezuela’s crackdown
item.dc:creator: Samantha Schmidt
item.description: A Venezuelan anthem reclaiming a pejorative term has gone viral but also drawn backlash from President Nicolás Maduro.
